Arthur Conan Doyle’s upstanding hero Sherlock Holmes engages in just as much clever deception as his nemesis, Professor Moriarty, proving that ___________ is not inherently evil.
A.	immorality
B.	brilliance
C.	cunning
D.	subterfuge
E.	wrongdoing
F.	judgment
